required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Genetic Association of Glucocorticoid Receptor Gene Polymorphisms With Binge Eating
clinical_study.official_title: Genetic Association of Glucocorticoid Receptor Gene Polymorphisms With Binge Eating Disorders in Type 2 Diabetic Obese Female Adolescents

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the present study was to specifically screen obese diabetic adolescent female individuals for BED, checking the variants of the GR gene (rs56149945; rs41423247) amongst identified individuals, and this led to assessing the impact of binge eating disorders on glycaemic control in obese diabetic adolescent females in Pakistan, South Asia.

detailed_description.textblock: Challenges in eating for diabetic adolescents can be categorized as eating disorders (ED) and disordered eating symptoms (DES). Binge-eating disorder (BED) is defined as recurrent episodes of binge eating at least once a week over a three-month time period and it is accompanied by feeling the lack of control and marked distress over one's eating behaviour. The aim of the present study was to specifically screen obese diabetic adolescent female individuals for BED, checking the variants of the GR gene (rs56149945; rs41423247) amongst identified individuals, and this led to assessing the impact of binge eating disorders on glycaemic control in obese diabetic adolescent females in Pakistan, South Asia.

primary_outcome.description: Presence of BED detected by individuals who score high on the BEDS7 Questionnaire administered

secondary_outcome.measure: NR3C1 Presence of variants of the GR gene (rs56149945; rs41423247)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Six months into the study after identifying all individuals who scored high on the BEDS7 Questionnaire
secondary_outcome.description: Presence of variants of the GR gene (rs56149945; rs41423247)

arm_group.description: Those who are diagnosed with having Binge Eating disorder. These individuals qualified after the questionnaire was administered.
Those who are not diagnosed with having Binge Eating disorder

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Unmarried females diagnosed with Type 2 diabetes > 12 months
- Age 10-19 years
- Obesity class I and II (based on BMI range of 30 - 40).
Exclusion Criteria:
- Presence of psychosis, major psychiatric or neurocognitive disorder
- Substance use
- Untreated attention-deficit hyperactivity disorder
- Use of psychopharmacological medications or psychotherapy
- Class III obesity
